metadata.synopsis: Player approaches Kansif (a stoic, honourable male half-orc) and Brawler Vez (a mouthy female goblin) after clearing a checkpoint and entering their camp in the Shadowcurse. They two Absolute cultists assume you're a True Soul sent by Minthara (which may or may not be true) and will ask if you brought the lyre needed to summon their guide through the darkness. If you have, you can play it and the drider will emerge. If you haven't, they can tell you where to find it.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Use debug book to reach SCL (Go to Region -> Act 2 -> SCL -> Mountain Pass).- Speak to the goblin that warns you about the curse, take a torch, and head down the path. - The goblin camp is to your south/left.- Speak to the goblin at the checkpoint.- Then enter the camp and speak to Kansiff on the wooden platform.

31.speaker: Kansif
31.text: We are ready when you are, True Soul. We need only the lyre.
31.context: NodeContext: Fixed smile and subservient - impatient but trying not to show it

35.speaker: Kansif
35.context: NodeContext: Bows their head slightly. This is their first time meeting a revered true soul

145.speaker: Kansif
145.text: Then pluck a tune and our guide will come scuttling.

1.speaker: Kansif
1.text: As the Absolute wills. We'll wait.

24.speaker: Brawler Vez
24.text: Ain't like we got much choice, is it?

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Forget the lyre - your guide will answer to a True Soul.
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

98.speaker: Brawler Vez
98.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Reach out with your powers to summon the guide.
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

117.speaker: Kansif
117.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*
117.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

120.speaker: Kansif
120.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

141.speaker: Narrator
141.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*
141.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

136.speaker: Narrator
136.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*
136.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

99.speaker: Kansif
99.text: *Your silent greeting hangs in the air a moment, unanswered. Then, from the dark...*
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

115.speaker: Narrator
115.text: *Your silent greeting hangs in the air a moment, unanswered. Then, from the dark...*
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

106.text: Yes, I hear them, your majesty. Calling us.
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

140.speaker: Kar'niss
140.text: Yes, I hear them, your majesty. Calling us.
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

0.speaker: Kansif
0.context: NodeContext: Formal tone, addressing a respected member of his cult, but the creature isn't listening - it scuttles away to look at something else and he trails off

59.speaker: Kansif
59.text: The Weaver's servant. Abhorrent - and captivating.
59.context: NodeContext: Formal tone, addressing a respected member of his cult, but the creature isn't listening - it scuttles away to look at something else and he trails off

4.speaker: Lae'zel
4.text: The Weaver's servant. Abhorrent - and captivating.
4.context: NodeContext: Formal tone, addressing a respected member of his cult, but the creature isn't listening - it scuttles away to look at something else and he trails off

47.speaker: Kansif
47.text: Greetings, in the Absolute's name. You have been charged with - guiding us...
47.context: NodeContext: Formal tone, addressing a respected member of his cult, but the creature isn't listening - it scuttles away to look at something else and he trails off

119.speaker: Kansif
119.text: Greetings, in the Absolute's name. You have been charged with - guiding us...
119.context: NodeContext: Formal tone, addressing a respected member of his cult, but the creature isn't listening - it scuttles away to look at something else and he trails off

62.speaker: Kar'niss
62.text: New flesh for you, my queen. But, who are they?
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: The DRIDER ignores the Half-Orc and scuttles over to the player, leering down at them.NodeContext: The DRIDER ignores the Half-Orc and scuttles over to the player, leering down at them.

94.speaker: Kansif
94.text: ...Best introduce yourself. Perhaps he'll listen to a True Soul.
94.context: NodeContext: talking to the player - deflated because you were ignored by another NPC who prefers to talk to the player

111.speaker: Shadowheart
111.text: Gods - a drider. I always thought the stories were exaggerated...
111.context: NodeContext: a little horrified, a little awestruck

109.speaker: Karlach
109.text: Now that's what I call an abdomen.
109.context: NodeContext: Subtly taken aback - not quite horrified, but unnerved

138.speaker: Astarion
138.text: By the gods. One of Lolth's abominations.
138.context: NodeContext: Subtly taken aback - not quite horrified, but unnerved

18.speaker: Wyll
18.text: Watching gods... there is no boot big enough.

107.speaker: Gale
107.text: Someone pinch me, please. I'd really love to wake up from this nightmare.

132.speaker: Narrator
132.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

45.text: I hear them, my Queen, but not your music. I await that sweet, sweet sound.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

112.speaker: Kansif
112.text: I hear them, my Queen, but not your music. I await that sweet, sweet sound.
112.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

29.speaker: Kar'niss
29.text: I hear them, my Queen, but not your music. I await that sweet, sweet sound.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

61.speaker: Kar'niss
61.text: Yes. We will stay. We will wait.
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

118.speaker: Kansif
118.text: Perhaps using the lyre would be the wisest course.
118.context: NodeContext: Gentling suggesting a correction to someone you respect. Stress on 'would'

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Take out the lyre and start to play.
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player starts to play a tune on the spider harp

81.speaker: Kansif
81.text: Yes, I hear them, your majesty. Calling us. Their god and their guide, together.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player starts to play a tune on the spider harp

42.text: Yes, I hear them, your majesty. Calling us. Their god and their guide, together.
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player starts to play a tune on the spider harp

125.speaker: Kansif
125.text: Yes, I hear them, your majesty. Calling us. Their god and their guide, together.
125.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

83.speaker: Kar'niss
83.text: Yes, I hear them, your majesty. Calling us. Their god and their guide, together.
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

68.text: Your lyre, mistress! What are they doing to it?
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player plays a tune on the spider harp, poorly

88.text: Your lyre, mistress! What are they doing to it?
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player plays a tune on the spider harp, poorly

15.speaker: Kansif
15.text: Your lyre, mistress! What are they doing to it?
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness - the drider hears you playing the harp badly

85.speaker: Kar'niss
85.text: Your lyre, mistress! What are they doing to it?
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness - the drider hears you playing the harp badly

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Take out the lyre and start to play.

121.speaker: Kansif
121.text: Minthara always carried it on her person. I assume she still does.

139.speaker: Kansif
139.text: Just hurry back, we can't wait forever. The darkness is encroaching.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I've other business to take care of first. Wait here.

64.speaker: Kansif
64.text: Of course, we await your pleasure.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Reach out with your powers to summon the guide.

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Reach out with your powers to summon the guide.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Reach out with your powers to summon the guide.

10.speaker: Kansif
10.text: What do you suggest? I've never known him to respond to anything else.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: We've no need of magic strings. I will summon the guide myself.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Open your mouth and ROAR - your anger a call. A summons.

51.text: *Your rage echoes throughout the darkness - and it makes a connection. Something notices you.*

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *Your rage echoes throughout the darkness - and it makes a connection. Something notices you.*

110.speaker: Narrator
110.text: *Your innate arcana roils and reaches - and it makes a connection. Something notices you.*

135.speaker: Narrator
135.text: *Your rage echoes throughout the darkness - and it makes a connection. Something notices you.*

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *Your music echoes through the darkness - and it makes a connection. Something notices you.*

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *Your power echoes through the darkness - and makes a connection. Something notices you.*

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Open your font of magic, let it pour forth as a beacon.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: Take your your instrument and play - your music a call. A summons.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Connect to the divine spark within you. Channel it - your magic a call, a beacon.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Channel the power of your oath, making it a call - a beacon.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: No need for the lyre. I'll call this guide myself.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: No need for the lyre. I'll call this guide myself.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: No need for the lyre. I'll summon the guide myself.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: No need for the lyre. I'll summon the guide myself.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I'm not ready to summon the guide just yet.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I have a lyre. It used to belong to a drow.

90.speaker: Kansif
90.text: Good, we were told to expect you.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Why do you need a lyre, exactly?

102.speaker: Kansif
102.text: I admit, I'm surprised a True Soul does not know this. Where are you headed, exactly?

127.speaker: Player
127.text: True Souls don't answer stupid questions.

69.speaker: Kansif
69.text: Forgive me True Soul, we are simply eager to reach Moonrise as soon as we can.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: If you want a tune, I know plenty.

3.speaker: Kansif
3.text: Forgive me True Soul, but what we want is to get to Moonrise as quickly as we can.

93.speaker: Kansif
93.text: We were told to expect a True Soul - that Nightwarden Minthara would send someone with her lyre to summon a guide through the darkness.

20.speaker: Kansif
20.text: If the Nightwarden did not send you, who did? What are you doing here?

50.speaker: Player
50.text: This land is weak, primed to be preyed upon.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: I seek my old home - for that I must pass through to Baldur's Gate.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: I'm travelling to Moonrise, like you.

122.speaker: Kansif
122.text: I fear neither of us are travelling, then. The darkness here is murderous - the only safe way through is with a guide.

116.speaker: Kansif
116.text: You will not get far without a guide. The darkness here is murderous.

30.speaker: Kansif
30.text: Of course, you are free to take your chances if you wish. But I will be waiting here for the Nightwarden's lyre.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: I do have this lyre, if it's any help?

76.speaker: Player
76.text: And where can I find this lyre?

137.speaker: Player
137.text: I'm here to destroy the Absolute and every last cultist.

100.speaker: Kansif
100.text: The lyre, True Soul? It will summon our guide.
100.context: NodeContext: Now a little irritated and impatient, but maintaining a mask of civility.
